instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
I got this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B  with coke spilled inside it, 

After putting through the Ultrasonic it came out spotless , It seems to want to try and boot without battery connected ( Gets half way through loading bar and the reboots )

But if I connect a known good battery the magsafe goes off completely and I have to unplug and plug back in the magsafe to get it to work again, 

I cant see anything obvious the board looks good under the scope. Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Be sure <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> is not shorted I/O.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Check resistance between pins 
17/18 = 8.13k
27/28 = 19.9 ohms

Be sure <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> is not shorted I/O. 
Is not shorted to ground but is shorted from I/O testing with another board I see this shouldnt be the case, 

The mac will boot on battery alone but only in SMC bypass and will boot on magsafe alone but again only in SMC bypass mode, if both battery and magsafe connected I can not turn on at all!

Presume <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> is dead and replace?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
"17/18 = 8.13k"
Fix that, don't touch <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>.
Check <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> was bad! replaced and now  <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52  are spot on.

But now I have 2.18K at 17/18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

Still only boots in safe mode and green light only

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> was bad, Changed that and now get 2.2 as scem says,

Now getting 140 k and slowly rising on pins 17/18 ? (what should I be getting here?}

Still same behavior,only boots in SMC bypass with either battery alone or magsafe alone. Does nothing with both connected but now does not  shut the magsafe off anymore

<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> still has continuity between the top and bottom pins?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: What is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (without battery)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
SO I went to check this and a couple of weird things from last night, 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (without battery) = .220v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage (JUST battery) = 11.96v

Magsafe green light is real dim and it will now only boot up from battery alone and does nothing with magsafe connected, 

Also noticed when checking voltages that <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> or a component very close to it is getting VERY hot when magsafe is connected , finger on board in that area gets a burn!

But as i said still boots fine with battery alone.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins.
Pay atention to pins 2, 19, 20, 27, 28.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Renive <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and check again pins 19 & 20.
If good, replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 93300, member: 682"]
Renive <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 
[/QUOTE]
Renive?? Did you mean reflow? or Remove?

If so how should I be measuring 19/20 and what should I expect a good reading to be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
Sorry for misstyping; I meant remove.
If <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is the culprit, you shouldn't get such low values (0.011/14), after removing it.
